title: Classes: Summary
question: Which of these are true about classes?
hint: The four differences between classes and structs are inheritance, copying, deinitializers, and mutability.

correct.answer: One class can inherit from another class.
A child class can override a method from its parent class.
You can declare a class as final to stop subclasses of it being created.
Deinitializers run when an instance of a class is destroyed.
Two variables can point at the same class data.
Classes and structs treat mutability differently.

wrong.answer: Structs can also use inheritance, but only in special circumstances.
You may inherit from multiple classes if you want.
The override keyword must be used in all methods of a child class.
Classes do not have access control keywords such as private
If you want others to inherit from your classes, you must mark it nonfinal
